metadata.Title: CVE-2010-3854 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the web administration interface (aka Futon) in Apache CouchDB 0.8.0 through 1.0.1 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-3854` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

couchdb - 1.2.0-2ubuntu1
couchdb-bin - 1.2.0-2ubuntu1
couchdb-common - 1.2.0-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: couchdb package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.0-2ubuntu1').
